alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 30 at 3:46AM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Potential for heavy snow above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Northern Klamath County and far northwestern Lake County. This includes Highway 97 north of Chiloquin. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible over 5500 feet. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. Do not detour during winter storms. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County
